doc.repnme: La micromedicion en el area rural : una experiencia exitosa en El Salvador
doc.abstracts: In response to the shortcomings of water services in the rural areas of the country, El Salvador began to develop water supply projects since 1993 using a system of recovery as a function of water consumption. This field note documents this experience based on the use of home micro-measurements accompanied by a sound training of the water services organizations in order to conduct an efficient administration of the system. The results of the process point to a more efficient, self-sufficient and equitable administration, which generates resources not only to cover operational costs, but also replacement costs of assets and capacity expansion system. The key factor for success has been the decision of the same community to use meters and apply tariffs on the basis of consumer use, for a more efficient and fair functioning of the systems.
